intro: Diapedium glabrum, commonly known as the smooth diapedium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Acanthaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale pink, often clustered in inflorescences at the leaf axils. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
